hints.content:
When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.

When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

Each digit of $55$ is one place to the right of the same digit in the number $550$.


Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:
$550$ |$\searrow\purpleD{5}$ | $\searrow\blueD{5}$ | $\searrow\cancel{0}$  
$55$ | |$\purpleD5$ |$\blueD5$

Moving each digit to the right means dividing by $10$: 
 
$\purpleD5\blueD50\div10=\purpleD5\blueD5$ so,   

$\purpleD5\blueD50\div\purpleD5\blueD5=10$

question.content:
**Which number makes the equation true?**

$550 \div 55 = \square$
